node.text:
This video is part of the Online Herbal Medicine Making Course. 
The herbalists featured in this video are "Artemisia Dawnsong," aka Juliet Blankespoor of Chestnut School of Herbal Medicine, and "News Anchor Beverly," aka Asia Suler of One Willow Apothecaries (http://www.onewillowapothecaries.com). MEDICINAL HONEYS AND SYRUPS

When the temperatures drop and the nights grow longer, my attention is inevitably drawn to the impending cold and flu season. Herbal syrups are one of my favorite medicinal preparations for respiratory infections, especially in winter. Silky and sweet, golden with summer’s nectar and sipped by the spoonful—medicinal honeys can be divinely flavorful. 
I prefer honey-based syrups over sugar or glycerin syrups for many reasons. First and foremost, I love the alchemy of honey—the synergy of flowers and bees, the sacred geometry of the hive, the fanning of wings concentrating summer’s goodness into a nourishing food that can miraculously withstand millennia. Honey also has its own medicinal virtues, imparting anti-microbial and anti-inflammatory benefits to the syrup. It helps to coat the throat, easing the spasms of dry hacking coughs and effectively taming nagging nighttime coughs. As you can imagine, honey can be quite soothing for sore throats. And, children have a special affinity for honey—they are typically a good bit more excited about taking a medicinal syrup than straight tea or tincture. 
VERY IMPORTANT SAFETY NOTE: Do not give honey to babies  under one year as there is a possibility that botulism (Clostridium  botulinum) endospores can be present. The risk is that these spores can grow into a potentially fatal botulism infection in a baby’s immature digestive system.

node.text:
Take a sneak peek into our 375-hour Online Foraging Course: Edible and Medicinal Wild Herbs, which begins in 2018! The course begins with the basic ground rules of foraging safety and ethics, and then moves on to botany and plant identification. Before you know it, you’ll have the skills and confidence to safely identify and harvest wild plants.

You’ll befriend THE most common edible and medicinal wayside plants, including dandelion, stinging nettles, violet, yarrow, burdock, rose, goldenrod, and many others. The printable manual is hundreds of pages long and filled with close-up photos for identification, medicinal uses, and loads of easy-to-follow recipes. In fact, most of our plant profiles contain more detail than you’ll find in any book on wild foods and herbs.

Registration for this online course is only open once a year. The course runs January 15th through November 1st, 2019! {The Chestnut School is dedicated to sustainability, and the plants featured are weedy, abundant plants with a global distribution. The course does not include rare and endangered plants.} #chestnutschoolforagingcourse #chestnutschoolofherbalmedicine #chestnutherbalimmersion #chestnutmedicinemakingcourse #medicinemaking #apothecary #medicinalherbs #permaculture #forager #foraging #foodasmedicine #wildherbs #wildfoods

node.text:
Imagine a medicine chest stocked with homemade herbal remedies, an apothecary lined with handcrafted tinctures, salves and tea blends. Picture a pantry brimming with botanical vinegars, oils and honeys. Sumptuous sauces, butters and salts, infused with the flavor and medicine of fresh herbs. All made with your own hands.

The Herbal Medicine Making Course gives you the know-how to create an abundant home apothecary. You’ll receive 12 videos, 38 lessons, and over 100 herbal recipes – medicinal preparations, wild foods dishes, natural body care products and culinary herbal concoctions.

The course is broken down into three easy-to-use modules: * Foundations of Medicine Making
* Bringing Healing Herbs into the Kitchen
* Topical Herbal Preparations and Body Care 
We recently upgraded this course with a whole new section on Herbal Livelihoods, which boldly traverses business topics such as insurance, marketing, legalities, websites, labeling, and an introduction to the GMPs. If you want to learn how to make high quality medicine and start an herbal products business, this program’s got you covered! The Herbal Livelihoods Guide is peppered with motivational tips and filled with ALL of my insider scoops for running an herbal business.

All skill levels are welcome!

node.text:
The Herbal Immersion Program is the most comprehensive handcrafted herbal course out there (with close to 100 videos and a gorgeous printable course manual that is 1,446 pages long). The program covers growing medicinal plants, foraging, plant identification, nutrition, therapeutics, herbal livelihoods, and medicine making.

If you want to be the kind of herbalist who has dirt under her nails, garlic mustard on her breath, and an apothecary full of homegrown medicine, then check out the Immersion. The course manual is blooming-hot with 1,446 pages, filled with bodacious botanical centerfolds and over a hundred scrumptious herbal and wild foods recipes. 
Your garden and kitchen cupboards will never be the same again!

The program features 93 videos and 152 lessons, clearly organized into 17 modules of herb-packed instruction.

In this course, you’ll delve deeply into: * Herbal Botany
* Foraging and Wild-Harvesting
* Edible Flowers
* Permaculture and Organic Gardening
* Herbal Materia Medica
* Creating Your Dream Garden
* Medicinal Plant Propagation
* Useful Garden Weeds
* Herbal Medicine Making
* Fire Ciders
* Herbal Cocktails and Mocktails
* Medicinal Mushrooms
* Herbal Body Care
* How to Make an Herbal Livelihood

and much, much more!

This course is best suited for those looking to learn how to create the herb garden of your dreams and establish a truly abundant apothecary of hand-hewn botanical medicine. All skill levels welcome.

node.text:
Which one are you today? 😂⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
But seriously, taking time to rest is no joke—it's foundational to our health and our body's ability to heal and restore itself.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We all know how easy it is to slip into cranky mode or overwhelm after a poor night’s sleep. Don’t skip on your beauty rest: deep sleep also promotes inner beauty! That may be easier said than done, especially if you’re experiencing depression*, as there’s a cyclic relationship between insomnia and depression—each aggravates the other. Many studies have demonstrated a direct relationship between insomnia and mood disorders. People with chronic insomnia are seventeen times as likely to have clinical anxiety and ten times as likely to have clinical depression than people who sleep well.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If you’re skimping on your zzz’s in order to get more done, then it’s high time to prioritize your emotional and physical health and get to bed early. Sleep doesn’t just affect emotional health, it has a direct effect on our overall health and longevity.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Do you think you get enough sleep and rest?⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
*A note here: therapies to treat depression are highly individualized, each person and situation are unique. People typically need therapeutic treatment beyond herbalism: this might include acupuncture, talk therapy, nutrition, supplements, or pharmaceuticals. Please do not judge yourself or anyone else for needing and seeking help, natural or otherwise!⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If you're in a dark place or considering hurting yourself, please reach out right now ~ there are folks who want to talk to you. And we're in this together. You are not alone. This helpline is one option: (1-800-273-TALK).⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Graphic by @punk_history. Original artist unknown (anybody know?).

node.text:
Consider planting wild bergamot (Monarda fistulosa) for its beauty, medicine and amazing ability to attract butterflies, bees and hummingbirds.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Wild bergamot is a close relative to bee balm (Monarda didyma), however wild bergamot will thrive in hotter and drier conditions.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Both plants are used medicinally to treat infections and digestive issues, such as gas and bloating. Wild bergamot is antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and diaphoretic (brings on a sweat to break a fever). It has a pungent aroma and flavor, and can be enjoyed in tea or prepared as a tincture.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The lavender flowers are edible and can be used as a garnish or tossed in salads for an extra splash of color.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
To learn more about growing and using wild bergamot in your garden and home apothecary, take a peek at our Online Herbal Immersion ~ it's THE most comprehensive online program in sustainable DIY herbalism there is!⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
🌸 Link in bio 🌸⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Photo © Juliet Blankespoor⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
*Please research any new herb and consult your health care providers for possible drug/herb contraindications and precautions before ingesting. Be sure of your identification before ingesting any plant or mushroom. Do not use wild bergamot or bee balm in pregnancy, as it is a traditional menstrual stimulant. As with other spicy herbs, it may aggravate heartburn. The name bergamot is also applied to the essential oil from the similarly scented Citrus bergamia (which grows in Bergamo, Italy). It is this citrus oil that is used to flavor Earl Grey tea. Many folks understandably get the two confused!⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Announcing a New Partnership ☀️We're teaming up with The Maternal Wellness Village @maternalwellnessvillage and @oshun_family_center to support birth workers and birthing families.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Everyone deserves a fabulous doula.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The Maternal Wellness Village is a collective of birth workers that includes Therapists, Doulas, Lactation Consultants, Holistic Healers, Infertility Warriors, and Registered Nurses. Their mission is to function as an action-oriented task force providing support services to empower communities throughout the African Diaspora. They aim to increase modern adaptations of ancestral birth practices, reclaim the Black birth experience, and reduce Black maternal mortality. The Maternal Wellness Village functions under the auspices of the Oshun Family Center 501(c)3. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The Chestnut School annually donates scholarships to The Maternal Wellness Village to support their work of empowering birthing people and families.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Want to donate? 100% of your donations will go to support birthing families. Link via the website @oshun_family_center⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
📷@oshun_family_center

node.text:
NETTLE SEED TRUFFLES by Fern Freud @foraged.by.fern 🌿⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Nettle seeds are loaded with essential fatty acids, vitamins, and minerals. They're also a trophorestorative herb for the kidneys and have adaptogenic qualities. They impart energy, which means they're best taken earlier in the day.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The seeds should be chewed thoroughly or ground. They can be added to smoothies, used as a seasoning—I like mixing them into herbal gomasio blends—, or added to treats like these brilliant truffles made with 85% dark chocolate and coconut milk. Just prepare your favorite truffle recipe and roll the finished truffles in a tray of nettle seeds.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Nettle seeds can be gathered in large quantities directly from plants that have gone to seed. They can also be ordered from select bulk herb suppliers online.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
📷 @foraged.by.fern, a forager, instructor, and wild foods cook based in Worthing, West Sussex.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
(Urtica dioica.) *Please research any new herb and consult your health care providers for possible drug/herb contraindications and precautions before ingesting. Be sure of your identification before ingesting any plant or mushroom.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

node.text:
What does it mean to decolonize your medicine? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
These are the reflections of Dr. Jacqui @among_the_wildflowerss of Xálish Medicines.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
"I am the Land Embodied.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I am the Stars in Spirit.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I am made from sandstone, quartz, sagebrush, volcanic fire & flowing waters.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I embody all of those who have walked before me, and breathe life for those still to come.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
When the path feels lonely, dark & cloudy, and I feel lost adorning myself helps me remember, center.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I braid my hair, or put on my jewelry & beads. Cedar in my pocket, flowers tucked into my hair, or mud on my body. I go sit w Kin who feel like Home {Humxn, Stone, Tree, Water ~ here, Sagebrush + Sandstone}. I sing & drum myself home.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This day was my 2019 Solar return, one of my fave photos by my blood sis. The last time I’ve been ‘home.’ Adorned in my fave ways.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
✨⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Sagebrush on Apsáalooke Land ~ gifted by Ancestral remembering⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
~ Come Home, Fam ~ If you’ve forgotten or lost your way, the Plants, community, the Land will remind you."⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Dr. Jaqui is a Yakama~Irish~German medicine maker, doula, and Naturopathic Doctor practicing alternative, holistic, and Indigenous plant medicine.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
You can connect with her blog, course offerings, and absolutely beautiful herbal shop via the link in her bio.⠀⠀⠀
.
Please see the article linked in our profile on Aromatic Smoke Sticks for alternatives to wildcrafted white sage (Salvia apiana) and sagebrush (Artemisia tridentata), which are threatened from habitat loss and overharvesting. 
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

node.text:
Bee balm species are classic mints with opposite aromatic leaves and square stems. The bilabiate flowers grow in clusters at the tip of the stem or sometimes in whorls in the axils. Their corolla tubes are noticeably elongate, perfect for a pointy proboscis or hummingbird beak.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
All Monarda species have edible flowers, which can be used as a garnish or tossed in salads for an extra splash of color. Just remember to pull the individual flowers from their fibrous flower heads. Monarda flowers tend to be surprisingly spicy and add a bright pungency to savory dishes. The flowers contain antioxidant and anti-inflammatory flavonoids and related compounds, including rutin, hyperoside, luteolin, and quercetin.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Bee balm is a gentle nervine sedative—on par with chamomile (Matricaria recutita) and mint (Mentha spp.). I also like to use the dried leaves and flowers in a steam inhalation to help break up phlegm in respiratory congestion.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Do you want to learn more about bee balm? Join us for our Online Herbal Immersion—we devote an entire lesson to growing, gathering, preparing, and using this flamboyant medicinal 🌹Link in our bio.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
